title: Sun Care in Morocco - New Report Available
text:
(MENAFN Press) Sun care registered healthy value growth of 10% in 2014 due to the increasing awareness of the potential skin damage from over-exposure to the sun and the increased tourism rates. Furthermore educational programmes in the mass media positively impacted consumers’ purchasing behaviour and consumption of sun care products. The 2014 value increase was considerably higher than the CAGR recorded over the review period due to continuous consumer demand for these products.
Competitive Landscape
Two international players Beiersdorf and L’Oréal held strong leading positions in sun care in 2014 each with a 36% value share. Both enjoyed brand recognition due to their global reputation and were positioned in mass sun care which accounted for the bulk of sun care sales. A steady increase in brand awareness of the Nivea Sun brand by Beiersdorf and Garnier by L’Oréal was triggered by massive marketing campaigns in Morocco.
Industry Prospects
Sun care is expected to enjoy growing and ongoing consumer demand over the forecast period. Increasing awareness of health concerns such as skin damage and skin cancer are expected to trigger higher value sales at constant 2014 prices over the period. Compared with the review period the predicted value growth is expected to be slower when compared in terms of constant 2014 prices. This will lead to increasing price competition resulting in promotional activities and price decreases. As a result sun care is set to register a value CAGR of 10% at constant 2014 prices over the forecast period.
